meanings.sent1: After coating the cookie in chocolate, she redipped it for extra sweetness.
meanings.sent2: He redipped the paintbrush into the can to continue painting the wall.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally redipped the same strawberry in the chocolate fountain twice!
meanings.sent4: The hiker's feet were so cold that he felt like redipping them into a warm stream.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully redipped the brush to add more detail to the painting.

meanings.definition: To immerse (something) in a liquid for a second time.
meanings.sent1: She redipped the fabric in the dye to achieve a darker shade.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler redipped the necklace in gold to restore its shine.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they redipped their fingers into the paint, creating colorful handprints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The explorer felt like redipping his toes into the crystal-clear water to experience the refreshing sensation again.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully redipped the strawberries in the caramel for a perfect coating.
